required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Self Reported Lymphedema in Patients With Endometrial Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Self Reported Lymphedema in Patients With Endometrial Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are interested in understanding how the patient has been doing since their surgery for endometrial cancer and if they are experiencing any symptoms related to lymphedema (swelling) in the your lower body. The investigators hope that information from the patient and others will help them improve care for women treated for endometrial cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Data from respondents will be analyzed to determine prevalence of patient reported lymphedema overall; these will then be compared to the prevalence among those who underwent SLN mapping alone, or a comprehensive pelvic lymphadenectomy (+/- para-aortic LND and +/-SLN mapping in conjunction).

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent hysterectomy only or with SLN mapping alone.
Patients who underwent hysterectomy with standard lymphadenectomy, with or without SLN mapping.

intervention.description: A questionnaire that has been validated by investigators at the Mayo Clinic. The questionnaire has 13 items to assess the rate of patient-reported lymphedema. The questionnaire will be mailed and then followed up with a second mailing after month 1 and a phone call after month 2. Within 3 months of sending the questionnaire a patient will be either considered as a responder vs non-responder. The date of surgery and the date of when the questionnaire is filled out will be captured.

study_pop.textblock: Patients will be identified from a retrospective database maintained by the GYN DMT. Patients will be contacted by mail for the first attempt at recruitment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presented to MSK with newly diagnosed endometrial carcinoma of any histologic profile clinically confined to the uterus and/or uterine cervix
- Underwent primary surgery at our institution, to include at least a total hysterectomy via laparotomy, laparoscopy, or robotic approach, between January 2006 and December 2013
- Alive at the time of study activation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Had documented macroscopic evidence of extrauterine disease at the time of initial diagnosis
